channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: Egypt unveils the world's largest museum dedicated to its ancient civilization
item.description: CAIRO (AP) — Egypt was inaugurating the long-delayed Grand Egyptian Museum on Saturday, the world’s largest museum dedicated to its ancient civilization — a megaproject also aimed at boosting the country’s tourism industry and troubled economy.
item.dc:creator: SAMY MAGDY, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Air traffic controller shortages lead to broader US flight delays as shutdown nears one-month mark
item.description: Travel delays were adding up at airports across the U.S. on Friday as the government shutdown drags on, putting even more pressure on air traffic controllers who have been working without pay for a month. U.S.
item.dc:creator: RIO YAMAT, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Controversy over Tucker Carlson interview reveals conservative movement's conflict over antisemitism
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — As Republicans accuse Democrats of tolerating antisemitism in their party, the GOP on Friday was roiled by its own schism after the leader of a powerful right-wing think tank defended prominent conservative commentator Tucker Carlson for his friendly podcast interview with a far-righ
item.dc:creator: NICHOLAS RICCARDI, JILL COLVIN and THOMAS BEAUMONT, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Republican leaders reject Trump's demands to scrap the Senate filibuster to end the shutdown
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Back from a week abroad, President Donald Trump threw himself into the shutdown debate, calling on the Senate to scrap the filibuster and reopen the government, an idea swiftly rejected Friday by Republican leaders who have long opposed such a move.
item.dc:creator: LISA MASCARO and MARY CLARE JALONICK, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs transferred to New Jersey prison to serve 4-year prostitution-related sentence
item.description: Sean “Diddy” Combs has been transferred to a prison in New Jersey to serve out the remainder of his four-year prison sentence on prostitution-related charges.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Court says Border Patrol official won't have to brief judge on Chicago-area immigration sweeps
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — An appeals court ruled in favor of the Trump administration Friday and stopped a judge from trying to get daily updates from a Border Patrol official about the government's immigration crackdown in the Chicago area. The court said the order from U.S.
item.dc:creator: CHRISTINE FERNANDO, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Monkey escape in Mississippi gives a glimpse into the secretive world of animal research
item.description: The recent escape of several research monkeys after the truck carrying them overturned on a Mississippi interstate is the latest glimpse into the secretive industry of animal research and the processes that allow key details of what happened to be kept from the public.
item.dc:creator: JEFF MARTIN, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Wisconsin becomes the 36th state to limit cellphones in schools
item.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — Wisconsin became the 36th state to limit cellphones and other electronic devices in school Friday, when its Democratic governor signed a bill requiring districts to prohibit phone use during class time.
item.dc:creator: SCOTT BAUER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: US Marine arrested, accused of traveling 'to meet, kidnap and sexually assault' 12-year-old girl: FBI
item.description: Active-duty Marine William Richard Roy arrested by FBI for allegedly traveling from North Carolina to Indiana to kidnap and assault a 12-year-old girl.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Alabama man charged with threatening rabbis, imam and others in multiple Southern states
item.description: MONTGOMERY, Ala. (AP) — Federal prosecutors have charged an Alabama man with making threatening calls and texts to multiple rabbis, an imam and others in the South, including telling one rabbi that “I want you to die.
item.dc:creator: KIM CHANDLER, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Top blue city university's newspaper tracks ICE operations amid frequent violent clashes with feds
item.description: University of Chicago student newspaper launches interactive ICE tracking map, soliciting community tips on federal immigration enforcement activities in local neighborhoods.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Trump calls on GOP to play their 'Trump card' as government shutdown drags on and more top headlines
item.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Jim McGreevey is back on the ballot, 21 years after scandal led him to resign as New Jersey governor
item.description: JERSEY CITY, N.J. (AP) — Two decades after resigning as New Jersey’s governor and stunning the political world as he declared “I am a gay American," Jim McGreevey is back on the campaign trail, running for mayor of the state’s second-largest city.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL R. SISAK, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Dallas-native pulls 1-of-1 Shohei Ohtani autograph on spontaneous card shop trip after father has a stroke
item.description: (WGN) — In the grand scheme of things, Rick Fayter and his son are a lot like other father-son duos across the country.
item.dc:creator: Eli Ong, WGN 9

item.title: Utah man accused of throwing 6 puppies out of car on highway, killing 2 of them
item.description: Memphis Lor, 25, was arrested on seven counts of torturing a companion animal, a third-degree felony. He has not been formally charged.
item.dc:creator: Sorina Trauntvein, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: King Charles III strips Prince Andrew of titles and evicts him from royal residence
item.description: King Charles III is stripping his brother Prince Andrew of his remaining titles and evicting him from his royal residence, Buckingham Palace said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: See it: NYC streets submerged as torrential rain hits the city
item.description: NEW YORK (PIX11) -- Heavy rain has hit New York City, causing significant flooding across the boroughs. The National Weather Service issued a flood warning for Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and the Bronx on Thursday afternoon through 5:30 p.m.
item.dc:creator: Video credit: Eileen Lehpamer, NewsNation

item.title: RFK Jr. says no 'sufficient' evidence Tylenol definitively causes autism
item.description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said there is not “sufficient” evidence that Tylenol causes autism, softening warnings he and President Trump have repeatedly made to discourage the medicine's use by pregnant women and young children.
item.dc:creator: Nathaniel Weixel, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Confirmation hearing for Casey Means, Trump's surgeon general nominee, delayed after she goes into labor
item.description: It was reported that Means was initially set to appear before the committee two days after her due date.
item.dc:creator: Max Rego, NewsNation

item.title: Chicago father of child fighting cancer released on bond by immigration judge
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — A Chicago man whose 16-year-old daughter is undergoing treatment for advanced cancer will be released on bond and return home, an immigration judge ruled Thursday. Attorneys for Ruben Torres Maldonado, a 40-year-old painter and home renovator who was detained Oct.
item.dc:creator: CHRISTINE FERNANDO, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: NASA takes one step closer to launching quiet supersonic jets
item.description: A supersonic jet plane designed to make very little noise took flight for the first time this week, cruising over the southern California desert just after sunrise in what could be the first step toward much faster commercial travel, according to NASA. NASA and the U.S.
item.dc:creator: SAFIYAH RIDDLE, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Cop's testimony, judge's instructions influenced outcome of Sonya Massey murder case
item.description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill. (AP) — The killing of Sonya Massey in her home by an Illinois sheriff's deputy was pursued by prosecutors as a first-degree murder case with a possible life prison sentence. Then the judge gave the jury another option when deliberations began this week.
item.dc:creator: JOHN O'CONNOR and ED WHITE, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Top Intel Democrat rips Trump administration over exclusion from boat strike briefing
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Trump administration’s increasing efforts to exclude Democrats from national security briefings could endanger troops and keep important information from the public, the top Democrat on the Senate intelligence committee warned Thursday.
item.dc:creator: MARY CLARE JALONICK and JOEY CAPPELLETTI, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: King Charles III strips Prince Andrew of titles and evicts him from royal residence
item.description: King Charles III is stripping his brother Prince Andrew of his remaining titles and evicting him from his royal residence, Buckingham Palace said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: CBP seizes 166 exotic pets, including pythons and tarantulas, from car traveling to Mexico
item.description: A total of 166 reptiles and arthropods were identified within the vehicle, including dozens of pythons, numerous lizards, multiple frogs and several tarantulas.
item.dc:creator: Mia Morales, KRON4

item.title: Blood pressure medications recalled due to cancer-causing chemical
item.description: A pharmaceutical company has issued a recall of hundreds of thousands of blood medication bottles over the presence of a carcinogenic compound, according to the FDA.
item.dc:creator: Nathaniel Rodriguez, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Trump, Xi agree to ease trade war in high-stakes meeting
item.description: President Donald Trump announced an agreement with Chinese President Xi Jinping to ease their trade war following a meeting Thursday, with the U.S. scaling back tariffs and China delaying export controls and resuming some soybean purchases.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, Fox 5

item.title: Vance spars with college students at Turning Point USA event
item.description: Vice JD President Vance went toe-to-toe with college students at the University of Mississippi on Wednesday in a nod to his friend and the late conservative activist Charlie Kirk.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, KRON4

item.title: Where the jewels stolen from the Louvre Museum might end up
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Seven people have been arrested in the investigation of a stunning heist at the Louvre Museum in Paris, but the lavish, stolen jewels that once adorned France's royals are still missing.
item.dc:creator: WYATTE GRANTHAM-PHILIPS and R.J. RICO, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Apartment building collapse in Turkey kills 4 members of a family
item.description: ISTANBUL (AP) — A seven-story apartment building in Turkey’s northwestern city of Gebze collapsed early Wednesday, trapping a family of five under the rubble and killing four of them.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Suspected killer loose after being mistakenly released from California jail
item.description: A suspected killer remains at-large after he was mistakenly released from jail in California, the Contra Costa County Sheriff's Office said. The man's whereabouts are unknown.
item.dc:creator: Amy Larson, WGN 9

item.title: Federal trial over Trump's National Guard deployment in Portland begins
item.description: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) — A federal trial over whether President Donald Trump can deploy the National Guard to Portland, Oregon, began Wednesday, with a police commander describing on the witness stand how federal agents at a U.S.
item.dc:creator: CLAIRE RUSH and GENE JOHNSON, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Taco kits recalled in 27 states over 'life-threatening' seasoning mix-up: FDA
item.description: The taco seasoning packets didn't contain taco seasoning, according to the company that produced the kits.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Langenfeld, Fox 5

item.title: GM lays off 1,700 workers at plants in Michigan and Ohio amid slower EV demand
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — General Motors is laying off about 1,700 workers across manufacturing sites in Michigan and Ohio, as the auto giant adjusts to slowing demand for electric vehicles.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Cuomo hasn't condemned bigoted attacks on Mamdani. In 1977 race, his father took another approach
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — In 1977, at the tail end of another bruising battle for New York City mayor, Mario Cuomo publicly spoke up against bigoted remarks leveled at his opponent. Almost 50 years later, his son is taking a different approach.
item.dc:creator: JAKE OFFENHARTZ, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Video shows dramatic rescue of woman from car submerged in South Carolina pond
item.description: HORRY COUNTY, S.C. (WBTW) – Video obtained by Nexstar's WBTW shows South Carolina first responders and bystanders rescuing a woman from a car partially submerged in a pond along a highway bypass in Horry County Tuesday afternoon.
item.dc:creator: Dennis Bright, WGN 9

item.title: Evacuation not an option for 3 Virginia couples in Jamaica
item.description: A Category 5 hurricane is bearing down on Jamaica, and three Virginia couples are stuck there, unable to fly home ahead of the storm.
item.dc:creator: Regina Mobley, Fox 5
